newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: BIL details new investments.
newsitem.headline: BIL details new investments.

text.p: Brierley Investments Ltd on Thursday said it had made several new investments during the year, which included taking a four percent stake in Fletcher Challenge Energy.
BIL said it had increased its shareholding in Coles Myer to 6.8 percent since balance date (June 30).
It had also raised its holding in building materials manufacturer James Hardie Industries from 20 percent to 26 percent and in UK brick maker Ibstock from 13 percent to 21 percent.

BIL said that since June 30 it had acquired a 25 percent shareholding in the former Forestry Corporation of New Zealand and had a 40 percent stake in 260 ha of development property, a golf course and leisure facilities on the Denarau Island Resort in Fiji.
BIL also said it had a seven percent stake in Macraes Mining Company and a 10 percent interest in English, Scottish & Welsh Railways.
Earlier, BIL reported a NZ$310.3 million profit for the year to June 30, down from the previous year's profit of $431.8 million.
